DOC.brief_summary: The reason for having a higher incidence of preeclampsia in primiparas may involve angiogenesis imbalance in these patients.
DOC.brief_title: Angiogenesis Markers in Primiparas Versus Multiparas: Relevance to Preeclampsia Incidence
DOC.detailed_description: Primiparity is one of the main risk factors for having preeclampsia during pregnancy. Recently, sFlt-1, soluble FMS-like tyrosine kinase-1, has been shown to be a major molecule involved in the pathogenesis of preeclampsia. Higher sFlt-1 mRNA, higher serum levels of sFlt-1 as well as lower PlGF, placental growth factor, have been found in preeclamptic patients. We intend to check the angiogenesis profile of primiparas as compared to multiparas.
DOC.criteria: Every delivery Preeclampsia or pregnancy induced hypertension
